channel.title: Pem on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Pem on TLDRBins

item.title: Openssl
item.description: Show TLS Certificate from HTTPS web server echo | openssl s_client -showcerts -servername 10.10.11.10 -connect 10.10.11.10:443 2>/dev/null | openssl x509 -inform pem -noout -text Certificate Show content of a request openssl req -in request.csr -noout -text Create Client Certificate # Generate a user key openssl genrsa -out username.key 2048 # Create a CSR openssl req -new -key username.key -out username.csr # Settings +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | You are about to be asked to enter information that will be incorporated | | into your certificate request.

item.title: SSH
item.description: Check SSH version openssh-server (ubuntu) openssh-server (debian) Config Location /etc/ssh/sshd_config # Grep contents grep -Ev "^#" /etc/ssh/sshd_config | grep . Generate SSH Key ssh-keygen #Set filename, leave passphase blank ./id_rsa #After Creation chmod 600 id_rsa Check Public Key ssh-keygen -l -f id_rsa Generate no passphrase SSH key from encrypted key openssl rsa -in id_rsa_encrypted -out ./id_rsa Convert .ppk to .pem format # Install sudo apt install putty-tools # Convert to private key in pem format puttygen key.
